availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Scroggy (Taylor County, Kentucky, tailor)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, tailor. Pennsylvania native. Married to Sarah A. Scroggy. Father of Mary A. Scroggy, William J. Scroggy, and Thomas W. Scroggy. Tailor in Taylor County in 1860. Private in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) from September 8, 1862 to July 22, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Division 1, p. 111.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0038.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 664.
